metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34266 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The libtiff-4.0.3-35.amzn2.0.1 package for LibTIFF on Amazon Linux 2 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash), a different vulnerability than CVE-2022-0562. When processing a malicious TIFF file, an invalid range may be passed as an argument to the memset() function within TIFFFetchStripThing() in tif_dirread.c. This will cause TIFFFetchStripThing() to segfault after use of an uninitialized resource.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5
libtiff-tools - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5
libtiff5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This is an Amazon specific dupe of CVE-2022-0561, see comments in SUSE bug

criterions.comment: tiff package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5').
